column4: I want to upgrade my kernel is this the easiest way? http://kernel.ubuntu.com/~kernel-ppa/mainline/
it fails on inserting my nvidia and vbox modules
no, those kernels wont work for nvidia, etc
why do you want to upgrade your kernel?
vbox performance on guest is terrible I improved it with a build but read that upgrade fixes
where should I look for a 64 bit build?
is it the 32bit kernel?   I know that is in lucid
what are the drm and drm-next?
I don't really know, but those mainline kernels won't work with the nvidia drivers.  You may be able to install the drivers manually, and virtualbox by grabbing it from the website
you could also try just installing the lucid kernel.  You could also just upgrade to lucid, but it is in the very early stages, and will suffer breakage
is there another safe place to look for recent kernels?
is there a list of whats broke?
